What the Mother F ing F. It just makes me angry to realize how much money they spent on all of the CGI and costumes and crap. How was this movie ever made, really. Steming pile of turd is too kind. Please someone kill me. I'm barely paying attention to this garbage and already picked out like ten things that this movie ripped off. (dressing up like girl scout---corky Romano--) (dancing baby singing hello my baby---space balls, and ally mcbeal) just to name a couple. And that Cummings guy, can we say uummmm gay. Maybe he needs some more gel in his hair and more sausage in his rear.

Uh oh spoiler. The end sucks, just like the rest of the movie.

And dammit Jaimie Kennedy. I'm a huge fan and shame on you for doing this movie. It makes it so much harder to defend you now.
Meh. Rly disaster. However it wasn't the worst what I've seen so 3 is kind of good for this film.

Jamie Kennedy your a genius! Haters completely missed the point.I have never laughed so hard,by the end of the movie i had asthma. This was the most thought provoking movie i have ever seen! Jim Carrey you suck! I'll bet you regret not taking that 10 million dollars, Jamie Kennedy was way better fit for the role than you. Boy did you manage to screw up the first one! This is a must see!! That twister scene was crazy funny! Oh, and that gag where the baby is running around the room, epic! This is so far the best use of CGI I have seen to date. Everyone should have the chance to watch this movie; I gave out copies for Christmas. Everyone loved it! I've seen this movie 10 times and it still cracks me up. sequel? bottom if you haven't already seen this movie, see it. You wont regret it!

review_title: Son of the Mask is worth the 90mins
review_detailed_main:
The jokes made me laugh, the effects were awesome, and the actors did a great job.

It isn't the original; or a remake which is a good thing. Remakes are annoying as it is.

Jim Carrey won't be in this; he is overrated anyways, "Fun with Dick and Jane" was just bad Jamie Kennedy stars in this and if you ignore the fact that he thinks he can rap than he's kind of funny.

Cameron Diaz isn't in this either and will never again look as good as she did in that the original movie Traylor Howard is this one; she always entertains me in the show "Monk," and for a dame in her 40s; she still looks great! So what that it's a sequel it's unique in its own way. It bothered me in the original mask that the freaking thing was made by Loki and they didn't explore that aspect; giving it a feel that it lacked something. Yet in this "sequel" they snagged it and that gave the film an original view. Furthermore, Alan Cummings did a terrific job in his role as the god of mischief. Plus there were some jokes that you'd know if you were a Greek/Roman history fan.

Moreover, the film showed value in the importance of family without being too preachy. If you want a movie to watch with the fam than try it out.

Son of the Mask is worth the 90mins.

review_title: Watch it and see a bad movie.
review_detailed_main:

For me, I can easily say that, this one is one of the worst movies that I ever seen. It has the worst performances, the worst directing and the worst visual effects. Sometimes when you watch first ten minutes of a film you can have and idea of what is waiting for you, however this period is not more than ten seconds for that movie.' The Mask' was a good film but this one is only crap and really disappoints the fans of the first movie. I could have written the things that I did not like about this movie, but then it would be more than 1000 lines and so no one would read it.

However, I recommend you this movie. Please watch it in anyway, so you can experience how bad a movie can be.

review_detailed_main:

review_title: Makes Myers' Cat in the Hat seem almost entertaining by comparison
review_detailed_main: This film isn't as mean-spirited as the Mike Myers vehicle, but it is just as, if not more, stupid and probably more vulgar. Also, as stupid as CitH was, Myers was at least able to elicit the occasionally snicker (speaking for myself). Not so here. There isn't a laugh to be found anywhere. Nothing and nobody is funny here. You'd expect Alan Cummings to inspire a few chuckles, but he fails miserably. As does Steven Wright, whose deadpan style of comedy is usually good for a few laughs. Not here, though, because there is no sense of that here. He just plays his part straight. The stupid cartoon dog and ugly CGI baby are also devoid of any humor. Any laughter you hear concerning this movie is probably that of a madman. Give this one a miss.

review_title: Whether you liked it or not, you are an idiot....
review_detailed_main: First of all those people who watched this movie and liked it, I cannot help you, in fact, nobody can. All I can say is you people throw off the voting curve on this site. I must stress however that those people who did not like this movie are no less of an evil. When I saw the preview for this movie in the theater I was fully qualified to vote on it here at IMDb. Now some of you may have found yourself in an unfortunate situation where you were forced to watch it, and those people will be forgiven, although I still frown upon it. The preview was enough to sell that movie as a piece of crap. It relied on the most primitive movie goers to laugh at the scenes in which the baby puts on the mask and dances around and makes Jamie Kennedy fall on his arse in disbelief. It was not hard for me to tell from the preview that this movie was going to suck eggs. For the people who went to see it voluntarily, you make me sick, and you should not be allowed to vote on this site.

review_title: I almost committed suicide after watching this movie
review_detailed_main: This is a story of an unfortunately guy who sat in an airplane on his way to Bangkok when he was suddenly forced to do the worst thing in his whole life: to watch Son of the Mask. It was on a huge screen in front of me, and because I wasn't tired, I had to watch it. I hated the Mask, so I didn't expect anything. But then it began.. the horror.. the worst 90 minutes in my entire life went by so g0ddamn slowly. I felt pain all over my body by every minute I watched. I tried to look a away, but I couldn't. I felt like Alex de Large watching Hitler movies with Beethoven music in A Clockwork Orange. I was conditioned by this movie. At that time I really hoped the airplane had to make an emergency landing or what so ever. But here I am. Still alive, and I feel guilty for myself that I have seen this , I will take these bad memories into my grave. Thanks to China Airlines. Well, after this, should I say something about the plot, the acting, the camera-work? The director, Lance Guterman should be banned for life, this movie must be destroyed immediately. And that's why I give it a 10. Because it must not get the cult status. It should be banned out of the "worst 100 IMDb list". If you read this, please help, give it a 10!

I thought that Son of the Mask would be one of those "don't knock it til you try it" one of experiences...BOY was I wrong. Son of the Mask is the lamest excuse for a sequel, even more than Staying Alive for Saturday Night Fever.

In Son of the Mask Jamie Kennedy plays a man who draws comics for a living, which is odd, because he is not very animated in this movie. Unlike movies like The Cat in the Hat which was ruined by Mike Myer's portrayal of the Cat, Jamie Kennedy's lackluster comedic performance had nothing to do with horridness of this movie! The only think saving Son of the Mask in my mind, is the kid inside of me...just kidding. Son of the mask would be not so unfortunate if it was a half an hour cartoon for children, but it's not. This was a large budget feature film for "families." I cannot believe that anyone in their right mind would make this a movie, or even star in it! I do understand Traylor Howard that you have done many projects since Two Guys and a Girl, but if your thought process of Son of the Mask or nothing, you should have choose nothing.

DON'T TRY IT! IT WILL LEAVE A SOUR TASTE!!

review_title: Not a Jim Carrey classic, but hilarious nonetheless
review_detailed_main:
I just finished this movie and my cheeks hurt from the grinning. Son of the Mask expands on the story of Jim Carrey classic The Mask in a whole different way. A baby is conceived while the father is wearing the titular mask and 9 months later unto the world is born a nightmare child with cartoon god-like powers. On top of this, the pet dog, now jealous of the baby getting all the attention, has gotten its paws on the mask and become a green-faced, revenge-seeking cartoon mutt.

Meanwhile, Loki, the fabled God of mischief (mentioned in the original movie, not featured), has been instructed by his father Odin to retrieve his mask due to the havoc it caused in the first film. Loki is the essence of the Mask and thus can also turn green and do the Jim Carrey routine, coming to a total of four equally bizarre Mask-like characters, though obviously none living up to Jim Carrey.

The father, and hero of the movie is played by Jamie Kennedy, the funny chap who was the film buff in the Scream movies ("Did you put her liver in the mailbox? Because I read that the killer put her liver in the mailbox..."), and he does a good job. Upon donning the mask he becomes the plastic-haired, catsuit-clad, cheesy game show host type (nice to see more different takes on what the mask does to different people) who is amusing though feels a little unnatural compared to the his acting in "Dad form".

Plenty of great CG just like the original, some spectacular visuals and designs, and for a movie so different to it's predecessor and so much more family friendly, it certainly does a good job of recreating the original atmosphere with nice lighting and settings.

So, would I recommend it? If you're a hardcore fan of The Mask in the form of comic book, movie or even cartoon, probably not, because it's not what you will want from a sequel. For slightly more open-minded people looking for some fun and a few smiles of nostalgia from nods to the original, totally. It's a side-splitter, particularly for kids.

There's no obligation to have seen the original; it works as a film on it's own as well as a sequel, so don't worry if you want to entertain your very young kids but don't want to expose them to some of the more "PG" humour of the original. Then perhaps they can check the original out when they're a few years older.

Underrated and great fun. It may not be the "Revenge of the Mask" movie we were promised all those years ago and it's not a masterpiece by any means (what sequel is?) but it's really nice to see a clever and creative sequel/followup to a film whose chances as a franchise we all thought were dead.

No passion, no desire, no acting, no great plot, no point in following the movie. no, no, no! absolutely dire. A big No. Where was the acting? Where was the passion? Where was the great aspect for kids? What was the point? Was their any? All this movie has left me with is tons of questions as to the pure boredom! I have never been so bored apart from the legend of Zorro. I was gutted that that dreadful actress who played the child's mother was in it. She lowered the tone of the movie. The screenplay was rubbish, it was acted dreadfully, their was no feeling after it. The film didn't catch me in anyway. It left me puzzled. It had no feeling, no happiness, no sadness, no nothing. Stiff wooden film, stiff wooden plot, stiff wooden acting, stiff wooden anything. Highly unrecommended.

review_title: The Pointless Sequel To The Mask: A Review Of Son Of The Mask
review_detailed_main:
It is common, especially for Hollywood, to churn out a sequel that is not as good as its original blockbuster. Watch the very weak Men in Black 2 to understand this completely in contrast to its witty sci-fi comedy of an original. However, after viewing such a flawed fantasy, I recommend this is how low you can go to make a horrible sequel! Choppy editing. The camera work was poor! You name a flaw in film-making and realise how many you can find in this doomed project. This is a visual guide how not to make film, unless of course you are a studio executive, who couldn't care less that such a film is bad, but a money-making venture for its franchise. As you cannot tell, I think this is how such a poor sequel was introduced.

So, what did I hate about this film? Was it the fact that they tried to be more creative than its predecessor? Yes, by the bowl full! In the original they at least had someone who gave an "animated performance" to the main character, who pulls all sorts of codes and convention from the world of Hollywood animation. I am talking of no one but some Canadian comedian known as Jim Carrey, in a role I thought was suitable for his brand of goofy talents. However, viewing the Son of the Mask, they fail to impress me with such antics that I could not stand any more, and cringed for every time such an antic was performed.

Was another reason the fact got anything to do with the plot of a struggling animator wanting his idea to become a show? Through that perspective, I guess not. But this sub-plot failed to make such a focus on the narrative of this film, instead they went to re-invent the antics that made The Mask entertaining, that I couldn't even care less about this animation-orientated sub-plot. Also, the fact is the film focuses on Poki trying to get that Mask back to his father was the main narrative. In fact, because of that narrative, the filmmakers, who I do not want to hear about unless they make something really worth watching, the excuse to proceed such badly-timed antics.

While on the subject of the main narrative, I will have a moan about costumes; that god's outfit looked so cheap and nasty that I think an amateur drama society could make a better job than that piece of ghastly clothing.

Also, while we are on the subject of the god, I found some dialogue either poorly written or badly acted. It was hard to tell. So I will blame both such a script that relied on the clichés of a family film to make the film have some continuity. Although from viewing this, I wished the writers had writer's block and go on to write something else. I will also put blame on some of the actors and actresses. Actually, I won't blame them; performing such rubbish deserves recognition, which will unfortunately be a Razzie Award. Well, the actor that played the god was terrible and so unknowingly, that I wish someone with much better acting training had the role. But I hope Brian Blessed will have turned down that role at such a sight of a poor project.

There you go. I have survived watching such rubbish, and hopefully go on and have a better life, and hopefully forgetting that such a flawed film even existed. But they do say, with bad films, that it is so bad it's good. That will never apply to this pointless sequel to The Mask.

review_title: Computer Graphics Do Not Maketh A Movie
review_detailed_main: Oh dear! I had so looked forward to a Mask sequel. Ever since showing the trailer and eagerly putting the original through the projector, I knew that there had to be a follow-up. OK, so it wasn't Jim Carey, but I thought it might be watchable. What follows is visual gag on top of visual gag and to be honest, they just aren't funny. Why? Quite simply, there is no timing. Imagine a stand up comedian reeling off jokes without taking a breath and you will soon find it boring. It would help if there was a plot or a little tension thrown in but I think more emphasis was given to set design. And to think of all the hours spent on the visuals. It really is a crying shame but I am being convinced more everyday that the art of film-making is being replaced by bright colours that bounce around the screen. My sympathies go out to highly talented Alan Cumming for being coerced into this. No doubt he was promised that it was going to be big big big. Take my advice and watch the original again (that goes to the production team too).

review_title: Worst movie I have seen in a looooong time
review_detailed_main:
This movie has to be the worst movie ever made. One would think that if a sequel of a movie made years ago has worse special effects than that of the first movie, that it should not be made at all. The acting was atrocious, and the baby in the movie wasn't even a real baby most of the time. If I was in charge of releasing this movie, I would first ask if there was any way we could just change the whole movie into a CG movie, so you wouldn't have to deal with the laughable CG effects used, and if not, I would just say to scrap the whole project because it was bound to fail.

In closing, this is the worst movie on the planet, if you are looking for an entertaining hour and a half, watch the first mask, or even ask a couple of local gangsters to beat you down, because even that would be more fun than watching this steaming pile of cow dung.

If you have seen this movie, and you enjoyed it, e-mail me and we will set up a time and place in which I will take a pickle jar and stomp your face into it.

Thank you for taking the time to read my thoughts on this horrible film, and hopefully you will take my advice and not see it, ever...Even if someone offers you $5.00 to watch it, do NOT do it, it is not worth the wasted time.

review_title: The only pro about this movie is that it has only cons
review_detailed_main:
This movie is so completely and extremely awful that you may be able to derive some strange, depraved pleasure viewing it.

I thought "Final Destination" was the worst movie I have ever seen, but maybe this one takes the cake. I can not begin to describe how painful this movie is to watch. In almost every scene they insult the intelligence of even the most brain-dead of masses desiring 'fluff' entertainment, and that is a challenge for any filmmaker to do.

This is a sickly mixture of Warner Bros. style plots using Garfield (the movie) style computer graphics which are horribly integrated with live actors -- and I use the word "actors" very loosely, as I think that "clowns" might be the more appropriate word in this case.

In case you missed it, this really sorry excuse for a movie has absolutely no relation whatsoever to the decent comedy "The Mask" starring Jim Carrey.

I recommend avoiding this movie unless you have had a full frontal lobotomy, or are interested in experimenting in a couple hours of sadomasochism.

This movie is near the top of the bottom 100 movies on IMDb, and with good reason !

review_title: Terrible, should not have made it to the theater.
review_detailed_main: This movie was absolutely God awful. Kennedy should stick to comedy because acting is NOT his thing. Outside of Alan Cumming as Loki the rest of the cast is horrible. Also, the storyline of the Avery couple is ridiculous, what husband in his right mind would give up an opportunity for a promotion to babysit his son and let his wife go out of town on a business trip. The only plus in this film is Alan Cumming who is funny in the movies I have seen him in.

The Reason this Movie is Zany, Odd, Wacky with Cartoonish Antics., is Because this is Based on the Animated TVSeries, & is not a Direct Sequel to the Jim Carrey Film. If, You take that into consideration.. & View it as a Standalone Film ... You can ENJOY it, as I did ... Give it a Chance. Cheers!!

review_title: Actually a good movie .... if you stick it out...
review_detailed_main:
Boy did this film have obstacles to overcome.

First of all, feel sorry for the rights-owners of the original MASK. After a brilliant breakout film (MASK 1 remains one of my all-time faves, have seen it 9 times, with EXTRAORDINARY performing by Carrey and Hollywood's first look at a young, pre-enhanced, Cameron Diaz) they could not have helped but noticed that the star of their film (whose career they helped launch) was now at the top of the A list and asking a $20 million minimum.

Ouch.

So they did what any self-respecting Hollywood producer would do -- in other words they did WHATEVER IT TOOK to do a sequel without Carrey and make sure it was bankable.

So let's be clear: Jamie Kennedy is a solid and reliable lead, and Taylor Howard is charismatic to a fault and carries her role in fine fettle.

But then you have the elephants in the room -- a lot of fans simply could not fathom why Carrey was missing, and took it out on the film.

And a lot of viewers could not believe that the script involved a mother getting pregnant while the husband was wearing the "MASK" and found that off-putting.

So, bottom line, by the time the final cut was out, this film had more enemies than friends.

If you can get by all the above (and remember that the hit TV series GRIMM uses baby-making as its main sub-theme, discussed in my reviews) then the final product is actually well directed, technically adroit, and a lot of fun.

I have seen it four times and it holds up pretty well, especially once you get to part where the baby is born (after the first 30 mins) Will it ever come even close to Mask 1? No.

But the reviewers, I think, down-rated it for all the wrong reasons.

Having nearly no continuity or connection to the first film, Jamie Kennedy plays Tim Avery, an under-appreciated loser who desperately wants to make it as an animator. So when an unexpected bundle of joy comes along, he gets more than he bargained for... oh god. Cheesy premise, yes, but is it watchable? There are only two reasons this movie was made. One: Money. (duh.) Two: an exercise in animation techniques and physical effects. Like those straight-to-tape Disney sequels, this movie strikes me as "practise" for animators and animation techniques. That said, the different animations and computer graphics throughout the movie are very good and are amalgamated with the live action fairly well. However, besides that and the surprising heartfelt 'message' near the end of the movie, the good stuff pretty much ends there.

Jim Carrey MADE the original movie. Now Jamie Kennedy has shown his versatility behind a disguise on 'The Jamie Kennedy Experiment', yet he seemed really restricted and NON-wild in his subpar prosthetics. Sadly, even a decent performance from super talented Alan Cumming couldn't really help a script that really seems to go all over the place. Add to all this a CG animated baby that "doesn't quite look right" and you have yet another shallow attempt to cash in on a surprisingly profitable original.

Is "Son Of The Mask" worth watching for the average viewer? I don't think so. Is this harmless family viewing? Mostly. But if you're an animation buff like I am and grew up on those Tex Avery-type cartoons, you MIGHT be able to appreciate this movie for that aspect. 2 out of 10.

Absolute total crap, totally far away.

I thought that the original Mask was really good, and when I by chance one day saw, Son of the Mask on Television, I decided to give it a try. After about 20 minutes I was angry rather than happy and turned the TV of, I just could not take any more of the abomination.

Poor acting poor special effects poor casting poor script poor everything the worst Jamie Kennedy film ever!!!!!!!!

It is just amazing that Hollywood gives this kind of crap the 'go ahead yet more millions of dollars that could have been used for some better purpose squandered away on stupid crap.

My Conclusion however is 1 star since -5 stars isn't an option

review_detailed_main: This was a bad sequel off the mask but some parts were breathtaking, but no, this movie was just bad, but not just bad, HORRIBLE! Yes Horrible! The mask was better and had perfect acting I should say although I haven't seen the whole movie, but I would say that that baby was annoying even the mom and the dad. Please avoid this movie and turn around and watch the mask instead but if you watch this after the mask, it will despair you bad and just will horrify you. It was a horrible appalling movie that you'll ever mind of and again please don't watch this movie.

Over 10 years after the release of The Mask, which was a significant hit and helped make its star Jim Carrey a household name, a sequel was finally put together and... to say that it didn't enjoy quite as much success as the original would be putting it lightly.

Son Of The Mask, which didn't star any of the original cast save for Ben Stein who appears in an early cameo, was a flop at the box-office and was critically panned by pretty much everyone who saw it. Set in a town called Fringe City, we follow wannabe animator Tim Avery (Jamie Kennedy) who comes into contact with the mask that was discarded at the end of the first film when his dog fishes it out of the water. Despite initially being reluctant to start a family with his wife Tonya (Traylor Howard), he conceives a child while wearing the mask and soon discovers that his baby may have inherited its powers.

Meanwhile, god of Mischief Loki himself (Alan Cumming) is forced by his father Odin (Bob Hoskins) to recover the mask and an unlikely Tom & Jerry-style battle breaks out between Tim's baby and his dog in the house. Not quite what you'd expect from a sequel to the 1994 film, then, but not without potential when you consider the cast and the budget involved.

There's certainly no shortage of things going on in this movie and yet Son Of The Mask still manages to feel completely bare and full of filler. This is due to a severe lack of character development, consistency or coherent storytelling throughout. Individually, the plot and its subplots sound like fun but together, they are smashed one against the other without any idea of how they might gel or work together to tell a proper story.

The film aims to be a Tex Avery cartoon but, where The Mask would only go all out whenever Stanley Ipkiss would wear the mask, Son Of The Mask is entirely shot through an obnoxious wide-angle lens. Everything is always over-the-top, loud and silly so Tim Avery never feels like a real person, his story never feels like one we should care about and the cartoonish stuff is about as cartoonish as the real life stuff so it irritates about as much as it falls completely flat. I should point out that the CGI, while ambitious, is a complete catastrophe and makes the film look very ugly, plus the surprisingly dark and unpleasant imagery peppered all over the movie does not help improve things.

A sequel to The Mask, perhaps one closer to the Dark Horse comics, could have been worthwhile and yet, without the charm of the 1994 cast and the overall competence of the original filmmakers, we are left with a thoroughly unappealing mess that's far too annoying to please anyone.

Sssssmokin'...

...is probably healthier for you than this movie.

review_title: Could have been SO much better.. and still can

review_detailed_main:
If you're an original The Mask starring Jim Carey I highly recommend NOT watching this one. Pretty straightforward review. It was cute...ish. And pretty much kept my 7 year old cousin amused for the most part. It was basically used for background noise for him to fall asleep with. Most definitely worked as he was out like a light within 15 ish minutes.

Besides the failed attempt on the makers/actors and actresses they shouldn't do a sequel to an already good movie.

Kudos to Alan Cumming however and also to the late great Bob Hoskins as they were the main reasons I gave in and watched what I could of it.

If You Enjoyed the Original Movie with Jim Carrey that was an Homage to Legendary Animator Tex Avery, then by all means pick up the Avery Box set and Relive the Genius. Once You are Familiar (or overly familiar like baby boomer's who cut their TV-teeth watching those gems over and over) and Know Every Gag by Heart (and still laugh), then Watch this Sequel to get Even More of the Zaniness with this CGI Update.

It is Mysterious (and a bit sad) that Tex Avery and His Animator Peers did this Decades Ago and came up with this Hand-Drawn, Frame by Frame, Looniness, that Thrilled Movie Audiences and then the TV Kids with Limited Budgets and Out of this World Imaginations and this One Costs Near 90 Million Dollars. Oh well, the 15 Cent a Gallon Gas is Long Gone.

While Nowhere Near the Depth and On Screen Human Talent like Carrey and Diaz are On Display Here, in Fact the Humans are Barely Passable, but Manage. The Movie Must be Given Credit for All the Revisitation of the Tex Avery Schicht. It Worked then and it Works now. It is Nutball Nuttiness and Sight Gags Galore.

In an Era of the Farley Brothers and Family Guy, this One is Guilty of Putting in Unneeded, Raunchy, Gross Out Scenes but Thankfully there are Only a Few and the Rest of the Classic Stuff just Outshines that Trendy Todayness. This is an Underrated Movie that is Definitely Worth a Watch for Cartoon Fanatics and for Those just Out for some Good Time, Slapstick, Outrageous, and Retro, Out to Lunch Foolishness.

Note...Any movie that rips Ben Stein's face off is doing something right.

Note 2...Don't forget to pick up that Tex Avery Box Set!

I would usually give this movie about a high 6 or low 7, but because it has been given an unfairly low rating of 2.2? I don't even get it. It's very cute and it's sweet and entertaining, you just need to give it a chance.

In 1994, The Mask captivated audiences wit its comedy, action, and superb acting. The film was left alone and untouched with a sequel. Unfortunately, some idiot came along and decided to make a sequel. Actually, more like destroy the first film entirely.

Jamie Kennedy plays the stupid, idiotic father. His son does crazy, stupid things that are not even remotely funny. It is pretty pointless. Alan Cumming wants the baby because of the god Loki. Loki and Alan cumming are really stupid in this film.

The story is simple, and a little inappropriate for younger kids. If you're into all-out stupid films, you'll find yourself having a jolly good time watching Son of the Mask.

An absolute pile of crap from beginning to end. Purile drivel and a complete waste of time - I doubt even a 6 year old who struggles in school would enjoy it. Everything about this film is wrong. It is cynically made to cater for societies most stupid people. Anyone who enjoys this movie must have an extremely low IQ and probably lives in a trailer with their wife/sister. Writing about a plot here would be as pointless as the film. Why oh why do people make this garbage? The contempt the filmmakers must have for the cinema-going public is astounding. I'm not a fan of the original film, I thought it was okay - but this? A steaming pile of horse manure that deserves all its criticism that it has received.

review_title: I had a headache watching this movie
review_detailed_main:
It took me three days to finish, it's that bad. Don't use the "it's for kids" card on this, parents will change the channel to ANYTHING else. I was considering not watching this after the first ten minutes. I think I deserve a medal for getting through this.

The CGI isn't terrible; the CGI is good for 2005 but it's presented in a way that makes it TERRIFYING! You don't want to see a baby's head turn into a balloon.

The acting is awful, however the actors shouldn't be cast away because of this poorly written and directed script.

The cinematography is part of why I got a headache. It's uncomfortably up close to the character's faces and it looks like a ring doorbell camera, it's very overwhelming.

It's not a terribly long movie, it's a little more than an hour and a half long, however the movie has awful, just AWFUL pacing. It throws a lot at you at once and still drags, again it's not a long movie, but it feels like an eternity. It's kinda impressive because of that.

100% DO NOT recommend.

review_title: One Word, One Word, There Isn't A Word
review_detailed_main:
There just isn't a word to sum up this, waste of my time, i could be re watching Hero or digging into a pizza yet i found myself on that beautiful night, watching what can only be described as one of the worst movies ever made by the history of mankind, EVER!!!

I mean Cumming who was amazing in X2, comes off as a cheap, piece of crap quite frankly, and the other actors.... who the hell are they The real downside about this film is that its meant to revolve around the mask, (maybe the son, but i still think the mask is more important) yet you only get to see the mask, mainly on the dog and even when on the dog you only get quick 5 minute clips then its off to see how that unknown actor is doing at work or how that unknown actor is ruling the world

The acting itself was below par, i say below par what i really mean is below 8700000 pars, there's no real feeling behind the acting, its just, 'Oh no the mask is back' now wheres my cheque

I would fire everyone and flush the idea down the toilet, why.....why ruin one of the greatest film by making the worst film in the WORLD thats my 2pence, and 2 pence i would not spend on this film quite frankly, its utter balls!!!

I remember watching Son of the Mask on DVD in 2005 when I was fifteen years old. It's not really good as its 1994 prequel. It's just awful. The acting is kinda very painful. None of those actors from the 1994 film, The Mask have appeared in Son of the Mask such as Jim Carrey. I don't know why New Line Cinema decided not to add them to the same 2005 film. That's a shame, isn't it?

I wish The Mask would be a standalone film.

It's probably one of the worst 2000s films of all time.

I think I always prefer to The Mask over Son of the Mask. I'd say The Mask is definitely way better than its lousy 2005 sequel.

If you're reading this, don't buy it on DVD or Blu-Ray. Don't attempt to waste your money on this rubbish.

review_title: A film made to make money off the success of its predecessor, but which has nothing to do with it.
review_detailed_main:
Anyone who saw the movie "The Mask" with Jim Carey, from 1994, cannot remain indifferent. It's one of those family comedies that marked the 90's and that strongly contributed to the meteoric rise of the comic actor's career. It was a film that, in my opinion, did not need a sequel, but that, if it came to exist, would have to have the same crew and a similar cast (that is, keeping, at least, Carey and some other actors). Unfortunately, this movie does everything it shouldn't have done.

In fact, any comparison between the first movie and this crap is pointless. It is not the first time that I see that there are sequels made to profit from great successes and that have virtually no connection with the preceding films. This is just one more example. Jim Carey was right not to want to associate himself with a project that failed at the outset, not least because most of the cast that associated with the film did not manage to take advantage of it beyond the financial inflow.

The film is clearly expensive and stupid. It had a high budget, which was invested in a range of CGI assets and massive and sometimes impressive visual effects, but everything else is lacking. And the film's biggest flaw couldn't be any other: the script is so amateurish and idiotic that it seems to have been written by ten-year-old children. Ideas are bad, there are a number of situations in which we feel that the public is being mocked, and our intelligence is being mocked too.

Another problem with this film is the total lack of humor. The movie was supposed to be funny and make us laugh, but we couldn't find anything funny. Much of what is shown was already done - and better - in the first film, and what has been introduced as new is a series of scatological or gross jokes that, I think, could have been cut. Even children's audiences might not be very interested in seeing this, if you think about it.

The cast does what they can, but they can't do much. Deep down, the actors end up being the least to blame for the fact that the film is rubbish. Alan Cumming turns out to be the best actor present and is the only one worth seeing work. He's an effective villain and his comedic streak is interesting, but totally wasted here. Bob Hoskins makes an appearance, but it is innocuous and adds nothing to the film. Jamie Kennedy is bad, he does a bad job, and surely he must be sorry he got into this movie. The rest is basically a bunch of extras, even when they have to talk.

review_title: Worst movie ever but hear me out
review_detailed_main: This movie is just plain stupid the only reason i watch it is because its funny and dumb its just a thoughtless movie its soo bad its good i saw the poster print on a krash mag at camp then i thought cool a sequel

It was so.. stupid, impossible to explain with words. And now the worst part: Loki and his "father" Odin are based on the Norse Mythology, but the creators of this movie has not even been true to the mythology - and that's what annoyed me they most while watching this movie. Loki is not at all as evil as they present him to be in this movie. Yes, he likes to do mischief, but he also has done many good deeds in the Norse Mythology - He is after all the companion of Tor, one of the main Gods. It get's even worse. Loki certainly IS NOT the son of Odin! The creators should have done their homework before making a movie with characters from the Norse mythology.

review_title: A big step down from the first one, but still wasn't the WORST movie I've seen.

Instead, the actors and acting were much worse and I feel strongly that this movie is meant for kids 10 and under. If you're older than 10 and watch this movie, you will likely lose brain cells like I did giving it the time of day. Not something I would watch again but no one can say it's not at least a little entertaining for what it is/trying to be!

review_title: Am I disappointed because it wasn't as bad as everyone says?
review_detailed_main:
I was actually scared to watch this movie because I expected it would be one of those movies that is so bad it makes you want to bang your head to the wall. But it wasn't like that after all. Very silly, yes, but not boring. It was watchable, though I don't want to watch it again anytime soon (or ever?). That was boring, yes, because it was just a mess. Towards the end it got a bit better again.

Overall: not as bad as everyone says. Just slightly bad, but not very bad. That is my rating. Not recommended to watch...but if you feel like you want to see it, go ahead!

Let me confess that I haven't seen Son of the Mask in about 13 years. In fact, it just randomly popped into my head. I saw this in whole when I was around 10, and I even tried watching it before then. It says something when I tell you that even as a child, I knew that this movie was garbage. I saw the whole thing once, and any other try was insufferable.

The movie follows a new father, who's dog and baby have gotten hold of The Mask from the Jim Carrey movie. After this, chaos ensues.

Like I said, I haven't seen this in 13 years, but I still remember how much I hated it.

The movie is for kids, but it's boring. It was not entertaining in any way, I was constantly waiting for something interesting to happen.

Most of the jokes don't land either. In one scene, The Mask makes the infant pee in 3 different directions. Isn't that funny- a pee joke?

Actually, ONE funny joke happens later due to it. When the villain, played by Alan Cumming, tells the father to give him The Mask, the genuinely confused Dad asks: "What mask?... Oh! That's why he can pee like that!" The villian is revolted by that comment.

That's the only worthwhile part of the movie, so there you go. 140 other people have given this a 1/10, and they are not wrong. Please watch anything else other than this. I have nothing else to say, except to say this is one of the worst movies ever made, and even as a child I knew that.

Reverse Recommendation: To see a better movie with Alan Cumming, see Spy Kids 1 and 2.

review_title: They didn't even kill the horse before they started beating it.
It was bad, but it wasn't THAT bad...
review_detailed_main:
It's a bit outrageous, seeing this film in the bottom 100. I can think of heaps of other films that are worse than this. Sure, this film is in bad taste, and it doesn't have Jim Carrey, but it really wasn't that bad. It was bad, sure, and I think a couple of the jokes were a bit too crude for my taste, but people are really overreacting. The movie is just meant to be a silly, crude comedy to watch when your bored. It's definitely not deserving of a 2.2/10.

Let me get this clear: Jim Carrey was my favourite thing in the original The Mask. He was very funny, and I loved the movie because of his comedic skills. This film, of course, isn't as great because Jim Carrey is in it, and because the jokes are a bit too crude for people's taste, so I can semi-understand if this got mixed reviews, but the reviews are horrendous...Christ.

We'll start off with the pros first.

Some of the humour in this was quite good. I liked the fast-motion jokes they used in this, which they used in the original. You know, when he puts on the mask, and he goes fast? Yeah, the filmmakers of this understood the humour of this joke, and they used it in their original, unique way. I enjoyed the slapstick humour in this, which I won't give away, and I especially enjoyed Otis, who was a constant gag throughout the film that was very funny. The pacing in this is way too fast, unfortunately, but I suppose it just matches with the humour in this film.

It knows it's audience, and it knows what it's doing. The film knows that it's a crude, tasteless comedy, which is why I think this film's underrated. It knows how to pull off a gag at the right time, and none of the jokes ever seem to be forced when you watch this. So, there's another pro.

Now for the cons.

I absolutely hated the CGI in this. It was horrendous, cringe worthy, and annoying. I can see where the hate for the CGI comes from, it was horrible, I felt repulsed watching the CGI.

The gags involving potty humour weren't funny. I know how I said that it was just meant to be a crude, tasteless comedy, but I think this went a bit too far with the potty humour. It was way too crude for my taste, and I can clearly agree that the potty humour was too much, and it made me lose my appetite a bit. I had to pause the film for a few minutes so I could vomit.

The original The Mask felt to be the better experience. When I watched this, I enjoyed some moments, and laughed, but in The Mask, I think it felt more coherent and normal, rather than jumpy and energetic like this one. The original The Mask also had Jim Carrey, which I think really boosted the original from this one. If your going to watch this, expecting it to be as good as the original, don't watch it.

Overall, I think it was a bad film, but it was nowhere as bad as critics are saying. You may like it if you can stomach crude humour, but if you can't, I don't think you will. 4.8/10.

review_title: Worse than 1994's 'The Mask' in every conceivable way
review_detailed_main:
Just as awful as I had anticipated. With that said, it's nothing so bad that it offended me - it's simply totally and utterly bad, to the point I kinda find it hard to hate on it because I just don't have any thoughts on it. It is, without question, undoubtedly worse than 1994's 'The Mask' in every conceivable way though.

Jamie Kennedy's version of this Dark Horse Comics character is truly dreadful, especially visually, though thankfully the film doesn't actually give that much air time to Kennedy as The Mask; like, he's there but it's predominantly the dog and the son that get much of the screen time alongside Alan Cumming's Loki - to slightly better effect too, the way the kid is animated kinda nearly works... it doesn't, but almost.

Ryan Reynolds, according to Kennedy himself, possibly wanted this role. It's lucky Reynolds didn't get his way, or he'd be stuck with a green ghoul in his past. Oh, wait!

4/10 is probably generous on my part, though there are far worse films out there that actually annoy me - 'Son of the Mask' honestly doesn't. It kinda just exists and I'm almost nonplussed about it.

review_title: There's Nothing Smmokin About This Dumb Sequel!!!
review_detailed_main: What's hiding under this Mask? Don't bother finding out, because this loud, obnoxious sequel (11 years later, folks) to the inventive Jim Carrey flick is downright unsightly. Jamie Kennedy is a new dad who can't figure out why his baby and dog are, literally, flying around the house, until he realizes they've attained some sort of superpowers. Was it The Mask making Jim Carrey a Star, or Was it Jim Carrey turning The Mask into a Hit?? Not only must he deal with their antics and try to keep his job at the same time, but he also has to contend with Alan Cumming, the son of a god who's doing his best to get the titular mask back. All of the effort went into the well-done visuals and about four cents went into the script and dumbed-down situations. So, the lame story drags poor Kennedy and Cumming down with it, too. See no evil by avoiding this

What once appeared to be a plastic faced Jim Carrey, but was in fact makeup, not appears to be a wooden Jamie Kennedy painted green. He reminds me of a fence we used have.

Son of the Mask appears to have killed director Lawrence Guterman's career. There IS a god.
